message.content:
{"id": "13269", "title": "Bug 13269: Incorrect operation order in jarpackager", "description": "When using the jarpackager in the Eclipse IDE, there is an incorrect operation order. In the same case for '.jardesc' file, a warning in the wizard's header would be better than a dialog box at the end. Currently, the jar file is created before the overwrite verifications happen. This causes the message 'saving manifest file failed' to be displayed, which is incorrect as the user chose not to overwrite the manifest file. A better approach would be to show a warning message instead. 20020409. JRT.", "OB": "The incorrect operation order in the jarpackager results in the jar file being created before the overwrite verifications occur. This causes the 'saving manifest file failed' message to be displayed, even though the user chose not to overwrite the manifest file.", "EB": "", "SR": "To reproduce this issue: 

1. Select some packages and export jar file. 
2. Select 'Export java source files and resources'. 
3. Click Next. 
4. In the 'Save description of this JAR in workspace' option, choose a .jardesc file that already exists. 
5. Click Next. 
6. Select 'Use existing manifest from workspace' and choose a manifest file that already exists (you can run the wizard once and then again with the preserved settings to make this step easier). 
7. Click Finish. 
8. A dialog will appear asking if you want to overwrite the .jardesc file. Choose NO. 
9. Another dialog will appear asking if you want to overwrite the manifest file. Choose NO. 
10. An error dialog will appear saying JAR creation failed, because saving the manifest to the workspace and saving the description to the workspace both failed. Click OK. 
11. Choose Cancel. 
12. Navigate to the location where the .jar file should have been generated and observe that it was actually created."}

origin.input_prompt:
Your role is a senior software engineer, you are very good at analyzing and writing bug reports.
It is possible that the bug report may lack sufficient details in the OB, EB, and SR sections.  In such cases, your task is to infer the appropriate details based on the context and supplement the bug report to ensure it contains clear and complete OB/EB/SR statements.  Also, improve the wording of these statements for clarity where possible.
To facilitate this process, please provide your responses in JSON format as follows:
{"id": "", "title": "", "description": "", "OB": "", "EB": "", "SR": ""}
origin.input_content:
<BUG REPORT>
{'id': '13269', 'title': 'Bug 13269Incorrect operation order in jarpackager', 'description': "Bug 13269Incorrect operation order in jarpackager Same goes for '.jardesc' file.prehaps a warning in the wizard's header (now that an icon is shown as well)would be better in the case of the '.jardesc' file then a dialog box at theend. If the user wants that they should use the 'save the manifest inthe workspace' option combined with the 'reuse and save the manifest in theworkspace' option.20020409. JRT. ", 'OB': "This is because the jar file is created before the overwriteverifications happen.Other notes:the messages 'saving manifest file failed' is perhaps incorrect in this caseas the user chose not to overwrite the manifest file (thus it is not really afailure). ", 'EB': '', 'SR': "Steps:1)select some packages and export jar2)select 'Export java source files and resources'3)Next4)select in 'Save description of this JAR in workspace' a .jardesc that alreadyexists.5)Next6)Select 'Use existing manifest from workspace' and choose a manifest thatalready exist (this is easiest if you run the wizard once and then a secondtime with the presevered settings).7)Finish8)A dialog will appear asking if you wish to overwrite your .jardesc file.Choose NO.9)A dialog will appear asking if you wish to overwrite your manifest file.Choose NO.Note that an error dialog appears saying JAR creation failed, because savingmanifest to workspace failed and saving description to workspace failed. If youclick okay you will return to the wizard.10)Choose Cancel.Go to were your .jar file was to have been generated and note that it wasindeed created. "}
